# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia function wrap_string(text::String; text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(text, r"\\s+")
    lines = []
    current_line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = ""
            current_line *= word
        else
            current_line *= word * " "
        end

        if length(current_line) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = ""
        end
    end

    if length(current_line) > 0
        push!(lines, current_line)
    end

    join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example
wrap_string("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Vivamus lacinia odio vitae vestibulum vestibulum. Praesent ut sem nec nisi ultrices bibendum. Duis non quam lectus, a blandit quam. Vestibulum ante ipsum primis in faucibus orci luctus et ultrices posuere cubilia curae; Sed commodo, magna quis bibendum rhoncus, sem quam semper nisi, vel bibendum tellus libero eu nibh.")
```
